item.title: MSCP vet
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:73, topic:278574”][quote author=Newty link=topic=367724.msg2799981#msg2799981 date=1243312446]
All Moparscape Vets vote (Also GMods and Administrators). To be voted in there must be a 2:1 vote (10 yes 5 no, etc.) The polls stay open for like 3 days, maybe more, IDK that part tbh.
[/quote]
It’s 2:1+1. So 11 yes, 5 no.

so its not forced voting? damn wheres the communism

It’s at mitb.[/quote]

Oh I didn’t realize that… Thanks m.dog.

Read full topic

item.title: MSCP vet
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:68, topic:278574”]There are a few desirable traits that are taken into consideration, and having them increases the likelihood of being nominated for the position and the likelihood of being voted as worthy by all of the ‘stakeholders’.

I usually take a hard line and only vote yes for users that display reasonable programming skills. To qualify that statement, reasonable by my standards and not so much the standards of this website’s userbase.

I have voted in favour of people that displayed genuine devotion to aiding other users, along with having a great attitude. Don’t bother taking such an approach after reading this though if you haven’t been doing it all along, because we can spot fraudulent behaviour from miles away.[/quote]

How the hell did I get voted in JK.

[quote=“sanga282, post:69, topic:278574”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=367724.msg2799251#msg2799251 date=1243269387]
There are a few desirable traits that are taken into consideration, and having them increases the likelihood of being nominated for the position and the likelihood of being voted as worthy by all of the ‘stakeholders’.

I usually take a hard line and only vote yes for users that display reasonable programming skills. To qualify that statement, reasonable by my standards and not so much the standards of this website’s userbase.

I have voted in favour of people that displayed genuine devotion to aiding other users, along with having a great attitude. Don’t bother taking such an approach after reading this though if you haven’t been doing it all along, because we can spot fraudulent behaviour from miles away.
[/quote]
because you be convict lothy?
How does the system actually work? does everyone have to vote or is it just on a timed basis and you just calculate the votes at the end not forcing people to vote[/quote]

All Moparscape Vets vote (Also GMods and Administrators). To be voted in there must be a 2:1 vote (10 yes 5 no, etc.) The polls stay open for like 3 days, maybe more, IDK that part tbh.

Read full topic

item.title: MSCP vet
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

There are a few desirable traits that are taken into consideration, and having them increases the likelihood of being nominated for the position and the likelihood of being voted as worthy by all of the ‘stakeholders’.

I usually take a hard line and only vote yes for users that display reasonable programming skills. To qualify that statement, reasonable by my standards and not so much the standards of this website’s userbase.

I have voted in favour of people that displayed genuine devotion to aiding other users, along with having a great attitude. Don’t bother taking such an approach after reading this though if you haven’t been doing it all along, because we can spot fraudulent behaviour from miles away.

Read full topic
